name: Roasted Tomato Soup
description: Hearty, warming roasted tomato soup with caramelized vegetables, blended with stock and finished with cream.
gist: Roast tomatoes and other vegetables at 450°F until caramelized, then simmer in stock and blend until smooth.
ingredients:
A large quantity of tomatoes (Roma preferred, but grape/cherry or canned San Marzano can be used)
1–2 heads of garlic
Red onion (about half)
Optional: tomato paste
Stock (chicken, vegetable, beef, etc.)
Heavy cream
Olive oil
Salt and pepper
steps:
1. Optionally peel tomatoes using blanching method.
2. Preheat oven to 450°F.
3. Roughly chop all vegetables. Halve garlic heads while keeping the shell intact. Cut cherry/grape tomatoes if using.
4. Arrange vegetables on a baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper.
5. Bake for 20 minutes.
6. Remove from oven and mix vegetables. Discard any burned bits. If pan has liquid, pour into a bowl to add back later.
7. Continue baking and mixing in 10-minute intervals until vegetables are nicely roasted.
8. Optionally add a few tablespoons of tomato paste near the end and roast briefly.
9. Remove any burned bits and set aside garlic head halves.
10. Transfer tray contents to a pot.
11. Squeeze roasted garlic from heads into the pot.
12. Simmer over medium heat for a few minutes.
13. Add 1–2 cups of stock.
14. Blend with a stick blender, adding more stock as needed for desired consistency.
15. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
16. Finish with a drizzle of heavy cream.
